snippet: Volkswagen said the impact of a widening emissions scandal caused its sales to fall nearly 25 percent during November.
abstract: Volkswagen reports November sales plunged almost 25 percent, and attributes decline to decision to halt sales in United States of diesel cars that do not meet federal emissions standards; some analysts say decline is sign that widening emissions scandal has soured American consumers on brand, as other automakers post strong figures for same period.
lead_paragraph: Volkswagen said the impact of a widening emissions scandal caused its sales to fall nearly 25 percent during November.

headline.main: While U.S. Car Sales Jump, VW’s Plunge
headline.print_headline: VW Misses Out on Surge in Sales of New Vehicles
